intro: Parosela villosa, commonly known as the hairy parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Parosela villosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
